alert.note: Alert for Benton; Clackamas; Linn; Marion; Polk (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 4:05AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Oregon, including the following counties, Benton, Clackamas, Linn, Marion and Polk. * WHEN...Until 915 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 402 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salem, Corvallis, Albany, Oregon City, Dallas, Sandy, Sweet Home, Detroit, Government Camp, Portland, Lake Oswego, Tualatin, West Linn, Milwaukie, Wilsonville, Canby, Lebanon, Gladstone, Monmouth and Silverton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
